title: Seafood and corn chowder

ingredients.content: 1 lemon, zest only, no white pith
50 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces
5 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
2 - 3 leeks, white and light green parts only (200 g), cut into pieces
200 g fennel, trimmed and cut into pieces
200 g potatoes, peeled and cut into cubes (1 cm)
100 g bacon, cut into pieces (1-2 cm) (optional)
400 g canned sweet corn kernels, drained (approx. 300 g after draining)

preparations.content: Place lemon and Parmesan into mixing bowl and mill <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add parsley and chop <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer mixture into a bowl. Add pine nuts to bowl, stir to combine and set aside until ready to use. Do not clean mixing bowl.
Place leek and fennel into mixing bowl and chop <b>2 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and cornflour and cook <b>3 min/100°C/speed 2<b>.
Add water, stock paste, lemon juice, fish sauce, potatoes, thyme, bay leaf and bacon (optional) and cook <b>10 min/100°C//speed 1<b>.
Add seafood mix, corn and pepper and cook <b>7-10 min/100°C//speed 1<b> or until potatoes are soft and seafood is cooked. Serve soup sprinkled with Gremolata.

hintsAndTricks: <b>Fish chowder:<b> Replace the seafood marinara mix with 500 g firm white fish, salmon or haddock, cut into pieces (4-5 cm).
You can replace the dry sherry with Pernod.
For more texture (and protein), add hard-boiled eggs, cut into quarters, to soup just before serving.
Please refer to The Basic Cookbook or the Everyday Cookbook for the Chicken stock paste recipe.
